doc:
"Paul Guilfoyle (actor born 1902)" 0 Paul Guilfoyle (July 14, 1902 – June 27, 1961) was an American stage, film and television actor. Later in his career, he also directed films and television episodes. Guilfoyle was born in Jersey City, New Jersey.He started off working on stage, performing on Broadway in 16 plays according to the Internet Broadway Database, beginning with The Jolly Roger and Cyrano de Bergerac in 1923 and ending with Jayhawker in 1934. He appeared in many films that starred Lee Tracy in the 1930s. In the 1949 crime film White Heat, he played (uncredited) a treacherous prison inmate murdered in cold blood by James Cagney's lead character. He died of a heart attack on June 27, 1961 in Hollywood. He had a son, Anthony. Guilfoyle was interred in Glendale, California's Forest Lawn Memorial Park Cemetery. He appeared in many_films that starred Lee_Tracy in the_1930s . In the_1949_crime_film_White_Heat , he played (_uncredited ) a_treacherous_prison_inmate murdered in cold_blood by James_Cagney 's_lead_character . He died of a_heart_attack on June_27_,_1961 in Hollywood . He had a_son , Anthony . Guilfoyle was_interred in Glendale , California 's_Forest_Lawn_Memorial_Park_Cemetery .
